availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund Haynes Taylor Jr. (Franklin County, Kentucky, banker and distiller)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, clerk, banker, and distiller. Columbus, Kentucky, native. Son of John Eastin Taylor and Rebecca Edrington Taylor. Adopted son of Edmund Haynes Taylor Sr. Married to Frances Miller Johnson Taylor on December 21, 1852. Father of Jacob Swigert Taylor, Mary Belle Taylor Price, Rebecca F. Taylor Kline, Eugenia Taylor, Edmund H. Taylor III, Kenner Taylor, and Margaret Johnson Taylor Fall. Attended B. B. Sayer's Academy in Frankfort, Kentucky. Clerk in Franklin County in 1850. Owned nineteen slaves in Franklin County in 1850. Cashier for the Versailles Branch of the Commercial Bank of Kentucky. Resident in Franklin County in 1860. Bourbon pioneer and distiller in Frankfort. Mayor of Frankfort from 1871 to 1880 and 1881 to 1890.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 105B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 902-3.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 137A.
